page.title: 07Daily Routine:Eastern Half
page.content: Most children get up between 7:00 and 8:00 a.m and are called by their Mum. They have toast and cereal for {breakfast:}the most popular cereal is cornflakes. Tea is the most popular drink; others have milk, coffee, chocolate or fruit juice but five have no drink. Most children get dressed before they have breakfast. Children from West Tytherton and Kellaways catch the bus to school. At {lunchtime,}12:00, most children eat a packed lunch and only six eat a school dinner. At 3:00 p.m most children get on coaches and when they get home change before doing anything else. Then most of them watch TV. For their {evening meal}most people have chips and some kind of meat like sausages, beefburger or ham. Five have sandwiches. Most children are in bed by 9:00 pm.
